{"step_by_step_thinking": "Zellweger syndrome is a rare, congenital disorder characterized by the reduction or absence of functional peroxisomes in the cells of an individual. Peroxisomes are responsible for breaking down a variety of molecules, including long-chain fatty acids. In the absence of functional peroxisomes, these long-chain fatty acids cannot be metabolized and therefore accumulate in various tissues, including the brain.", "answer_choice": "C. Long chain fatty acid"}
